meanings.definition: Covered in or tasting like jam.
meanings.sent1: The toast was so jammy, it was dripping with sweetness.
meanings.sent2: The jammy strawberries were perfect for making a delicious dessert.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally spilled jam all over her shirt, making it jammy and sticky.
meanings.sent4: The jammy sunset painted the sky in shades of orange and red.
meanings.sent5: The jammy flavor of the pie lingered on his taste buds long after he finished eating.

meanings.definition: Having good luck or being fortunate.
meanings.sent1: He felt jammy when he found money on the street.
meanings.sent2: The team had a jammy win in the final seconds of the game.
meanings.sent3: She always seemed to have a jammy streak, winning every contest she entered.
meanings.sent4: His jammy charm seemed to bring good fortune wherever he went.
meanings.sent5: The jammy coincidence of meeting his old friend on the same day he won the lottery was unbelievable.
